Outstanding!  I have to preface my review by saying this is a heavy meal.  But if that's what you are expecting from an Italian dinner you are at the right address.    Not your normal chain resturant.  This place has character. The owner has an open presence and is very proud of his establishment.    Our server, Chaz, had expert product knowledge and was able to make recommendations and minor changes to fit our taste.  He was very exacting in his delivery of the specials and articulate with out being pretentious.   Family style buffalo mozzarella and tomatoes, rich and and flavorful bruschetta were a great start to a fantastic meal.    The portion of the four cheese chicken smothered with mushroom sauce was fantastic.  The portion was huge.  My wife had to stop me from overheating.  All others in our party were pleased with their entree and commented on the quality, flavor and generous portions.    I recommend this resturant and would definitely go back.

The section we sat in near the bar wasn't particularly clean considering the prices on the menu and the initial service was not great and that had me worried but everything was great when the food came out.  It all tasted awesome.  The cocktails were also good.
If your looking for great Italian food...this is the place!  Calamari to die for and the veal was unbelievable!

HOME MADE EVERYTHING! Chicken Alfredo with chicken smoked in house. Certainly worth the $6 more than the chain. Sausage and meatballs all freshly make same day! Next visit I got a steak, I said what do you have. They asked me what I wanted. Went to the back and told me what looked the best, cut in house. Ribeye was amazing Prime beef and cheaper that the steakhouse down the street. For sides I mentioned a veggie, they started listing around 15 different options and said what would you like, any or all. Taking the better half there for her birthday tonight!

Wow! The chef wow' me. I have a favorite Italian place. This is my new favorite Italian place. Went for my birthday last night and was really pleased. Started with a comfortable booth. I'm old, I have back issues. Thank you for booths. Then a lovely wine list. You don't know wine? Fuggetaboutit. Order a beer and move on. The fried ravioli appetizer were to die for. My husband had a shrimp Dish and this was  huge portion of prawns and seafood in a sauce that caused a flavorgasm in my mouth. I ordered my usual, Eggplant parmigiana. But this was not the usual, it was amazing. My husband doesn't eat eggplant and ate some, it's that good. The place is charming, quiet if you go early and the staff is friendly and professional yet casual. Husband said I made sex noises the whole meal. He liked it a lot. Cannoli that tasted like dreams instead of birthday cake for me. Oh yes we'll be back.

Horrible service. Waiter didn't check on us once except for announcing to all tables in the section at once to let him know if you need anything. Food was the worst Italian we've had in Scottsdale. Decor is outdated and menu is way overpriced.

While visiting the area we were looking for authentic Italian food and something that we don't have in Cincinnati. I am so glad that we chose this wonderful place! The bread, dipping oil, salads, lasagna and Florentine cannelloni were out of this world! I would highly recommend this to anyone! You will not be disappointed.

We dined at La Torretta again last night, and as it has been since we discovered it about two years ago, it was FANTASTIC! The food and service was impeccable. There were six of us and four had the pasta special which had jumbo prawns, rock shrimp, peas and a scrumptious cream sauce. OMG...can't wait for tonight for the leftovers. Another had the Osso Buco (also a special) which was heavenly and one had the Hawaiian Sun Fish with a sauce on the side, and they said it was wonderful. We enjoy coming to this charming place when there is a special occasion and there were two birthdays being celebrated last night. We were all so pleasantly full from the dinner and really didn't think that there would be any room for dessert, but Darius insisted that he bring out six mini Cannoli's (two had candles) and these certainly added a delightful finishing touch to a terrific evening. The staff is always so attentive and Darius, the owner, has a great sense of humor, is a good conversationalist, and truly makes us feel welcome and appreciated every time we're there. We look forward to a return visit very soon. Bill T. Phoenix
We sat at the bar and had a great bottle of wine and some wonderfully prepared food. Chaz did an outstanding job taking care of us. We also had their escargot and it was, buttery and bubbly.

My gentleman friend and I are here last night and it was wonderful.  I had the veal picatta with garlic over angel pasta.  Delicious! My date was thoroughly impressed with the food and service.  This is a great place for a date!!
Food is awful, I think they unfreeze the food and try and pass it off as fresh or cooked.   Stay away.

Darius offered incredible service and ensured our experience was exceptional. We will definitely be returning for a delicious meal and wonderful atmosphere. I would definitely recommend to friends or family.

A definite gem here in Scottsdale.   It's definitely our favorite Italian restaurant in town!  We keep coming back for the food and amazing service.  We have tried all the pasta, fish, apps and salads. Our fav is their  meat sauce and cannelloni.  Don't settle for chain restaurant Italian when you can have so much better food here!!!

I am from San Francisco on business in North Scottsdale, and I saw this restaurant on Groupon. I was able to purchase the groupon for $40 worth of food and drink for $20 and was very excited about it! When I got there at 7:30 on a Tuesday night, the place was pretty dead. There were about 5 tables filled out of 25 or so. An older couple came in and knew everyone, so were obvious "regulars", and they seemed to love the place. I ordered the White Bean Soup and the Ribeye steak with Gorgonzola sauce. The White Bean Soup was piping hot and delicious. The little bit of shredded Parmesan that melted into my spoon made the soup delectable. A waiter notified me shortly after I ordered that the ribeye was not available as the meat guy hadn't come. He substituted the porterhouse at no extra charge with the same Gorgonzola sauce that would have been on the ribeye. The steak was okay. The sauce was good, but the Gorgonzola overpowered the flavor of the steak. The steak was a little thin (hence why I'd rather have a thicker Ribeye than a thinner porterhouse). The roasted potatoes that came with the dish were delicious and the vegetables were tasty. I took 2 stars off for ambiance, not having the ribeye, and just overall satisfaction with the meal. I feel that if I had the ribeye, this might have been a 4 star.

We had a living social deal here plus its super close to my company's vacation condos so we just had to try it. It was delicious, 5 stars all around. Our server Chaz was friendly and and the service from everyone at the restaurant was impeccable. Very attentive, always filling our waters, but the perfect amount of also leaving us alone to enjoy the food and ambiance. We started with the sauteed calamari. I went in with every intention of ordering fried but I am so glad we chose the other preparation. It had just the right amount of spice and we absolutely loved it. We both got chicken dishes but I highly recommend the one my boyfriend ordered. Chicken with 4 cheeses is the easy way of saying it. The mushrooms that surrounded it and the perfection of the cheeses and prosciutto along with the chicken...just amazing. The prices are reasonable for what you get. The portions are large and the pasta and sauces are homemade.   If you're not sure where to go for Italian and you find yourself in the Kierland area, please do yourself a favor, don't support the chains like maggianos, head over to this local gem and you won't regret it.

I'd like to give this more stars as it is family owned but I just couldn't. .  The only reason we went to this restaurant was we had a groupon for two entrees up to 25 each and a house bottle of wine.  The staff was extremely friendly, attentive and engaging.  There were a couple options with the house wine and we went with the merlot.    The food was average, portions small to average.  Im not sure if I'd come here again as the price for the quality of food isn't worth it to me.   The groupon was a bust.  It cost  $39.00 and was a "$78" dollar value.  Total spending on groupon plus tax tip and a bottle of water was 69.00.   The entrees we picked were 22 and 23 dollars.  Our included bottle of wine was 26 dollars. Of course I googled it.  Turned out to be  a   $3.00 bottle of wine called 3 wishes from Cali.   Quite the mark up.  Next time i'll go to whole foods and get the case for 33.00.  Groupon didn't provided much of a savings on this.

Chaz was our server, and he was the best thing about this restaurant. He tried everything to find a red wine that I would like but there just wasn't one that wasn't either sour or so five years ago or it was a cheap brand that I could get for eight dollars at the grocery store. Interesting that when you walk in the door there is a ton of empty "Coppola" bottles, but it's not on the wine menu. They really need to look to that. Coppola is a nice in between priced wine that would go with their food nicely. After my wine debacle I was hoping that I would love the food because other yelpers had reviewed this restaurant with three and four stars.  I ordered the eggplant Parm, my husband ordered veal Parm, my friends ordered the cannelloni , the pasta fagoli soup, and the linguine with clam sauce. The eggplant was mushy, the veal Parm was pretty bland although the veal was cooked nicely. The cannelloni had too much meat in the sauce over the top and the pasta visual soup although tasty with the chickpeas was over-the-top garlicky. The table agreed that the linguine with clam sauce was the best. The rolls they served were yummy and the house and Caesar salad's were good. The lemon cello was just OK, and the escargot was just OK. I think the problem is that the sauce is forgettable and the presentation using carrots, broccoli and cauliflower pieces is rather lackluster. I think because this restaurant is in Scottsdale I expected amazing homemade food with beautiful well-thought-out presentation. Instead I got my great aunt Maria's homemade family style food that you would like when you go to visit her because you love her and she worked hard to make it for you but it's not your favorite.  Anyway I'm sorry LaToretta but I won't be returning unless my friends want to go and then I'll just go to be with them and not for the food.

I have driven past La Torretta Ristorante more times than I can count, so on a whim one evening when I was craving some Italian food (which doesn't happen all too often) I decided to finally give this hidden spot a chance. Walking in I felt like I was being transported back to the late 1980's or the early 90's when peach and mural walls were all the rage. Place had maybe 3 tables on an early Sunday evening,   First glance, I was a little surprised by the prices they were charging but was hoping that the food would be well worth the $25.00 a plate pasta dish prices. A few take notes... The best part of the evening was their bread service and their house infused olive oil. I could have spent my evening making that my dinner thankfully they sell their oil by the jar so I know one thing is for sure, I will be back to buy a bottle of it. The not so good was my not so good linguine and clams. It tasted like they threw a couple fresh clams on top and poured a can of clams on top of the pasta. I was super bummed, I was really hoping this place was going to be my new found hidden Italian gem. Not so much. For the prices they charge the food should reflect it.   Hate to say it, but I won't be back... I love to support local businesses and the service was amazing and friendly.

HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!! Eaten here before and loved it! Arrived at 6 PM on Saturday night  Asked to sit at the bar and told "No" and a two hour wait for a table.  The bar was empty!! Lived in NYC for nine years and visit Las Vegas 4-5 times yearly.  Never had a problem eating at the bar until tonight. What restaurant can afford to have empty seats?

Went there with a homerun.com certificate.  Food and service were excellent.  The wait staff paid attention, but not too much.  The food was hot and very good.  Presentation was excellent.  If you want a relaxing night out this is a great place!

The best Italian in AZ! Hands down. Came for our anniversary and we couldn't have celebrated at a better place. The service was wonderful, very accommodating and had the best attitude! We will definitely be back...   The only thing it needed was to be a little darker, with all candles lit, this would have set more of a romantic tone and fit the decor and table settings better.

Be careful if you have a groupon. Make sure you are CLEAR. Waiter said we cud order off the whole menu and we cud apply $26 toward our wine. I asked again can we order off the whole menu and he said yes! Well when we got our bill we had to pay the difference. He said sorry. I felt duped and had to pay $65 not much  of a deal after all. Not very happy and won't be going back.

My friend and I were staying at a resort down the road for the weekend and came for some good Italian food. She had never been here, and I suggested the Eggplant Parmigiana that I'd had before. I got the Chicken Piccata and the lemon/caper sauce was tasty. They come with a mixed veggie side, and we both requested a substitution on the side pasta, Cappellini w/red sauce, rather than the ones noted on the menu. We were both pleased with our entrees, and as usual, the sauce for the bread is always a hit. Only negatives were that I'm not crazy about the bread rolls served before the meal, fresh and warm. They're not bad, just have had better Italian bread/rolls elsewhere. Also the red sauce needed more kick, so next time I'll order it spicy:-) The best part was our server, Chaz, who was very attentive and waited on us patiently and efficiently. He had knowledge of the food and wine when we asked questions, and made sure we had a nice dining experience. Will request him next time I'm in. (Ironically, I could have posted the same review as Julia S from 6/24/17 about the service, etc.) *I see some reviews blasting the furniture and atmosphere as being "old," and the food "outdated"? I am old, I guess, at 65, but don't look it, and I'm very young at heart. I love the "traditional" Italian dishes, the booths are quite comfy, murals and artwork are beautiful, and do enjoy the quiet, relaxing atmosphere where you can actually hear each other when you talk. Those are the things that make you feel like you are enjoying a good home-cooked Italian meal in a pleasant NY restaurant, like back in the day. They serve all the favorites, along with a plethora of other delicious choices, in a very extended menu, and creative daily specials. I guess you Youngsters who want a hip, loud, crowded place, and food with a more modern twist need to go elsewhere :-)

Excellent food and service. Chef had no problem honoring special request. Tortellini Carbonara and Spaghetti with meatball and sausage were very tasty. Ended with the cheesecake which I also highly recommend.

My husband and I recently chose La Torretta for our date night.  The decor is old school Italian and the ambiance is nice.  I would say it would appeal to an older crowd but I personally enjoyed the unpretentious and quiet atmosphere.  A great place for quiet conversation. We had the most amazing service by the owner.  He seems like a great guy!  Friendly, helpful and willing to please.  We enjoyed some wine to accompany the delicious bread and out of this world tapenade.  The Caesar salad was light and I loved the Parmesan crisp.  For entrees we enjoyed the lasagna (very authentic and yes we've enjoyed time in Italy) as well as the gnocchi and the butternut squash ravioli-both were really good as well.  Ended the night with their twist on tiramisu. The prices are a little high so I had been hesitant to try but they fit the area and I would definitely return.

My husband and I went to La Torretta ristorante to celebrate our 36th wedding anniversary. We had Chaz seat us,he made us feel welcome and explained in detail how dishes are prepared and allowed us to customize our dishes.my husband enjoyed his Australian Sea Bass and I loved my pasta Fagioli soup and chicken Genovese with capers. Chaz stopped at our table often,to see if we were needing anything. We felt like family!!and yes we love Sinatra music!
The tall dark handsome and VERY funny server is fabulous...the food was DELICIOUS(I had chicken milanese...yummm....GREAT italian food

Came here last night with the wife for a date night, I bought a groupon like a few others on here.  I quickly realized that this used to be the old Tomaso's which is still on Camelback.  The atmosphere is a little dated, I remember it being the same when it was Tomaso's about 10-15 years ago.  I called for reservations a few hours earlier and was able to get a 6:15 reservation.  Place was still calm then but by the time we left it was pretty packed (Friday night).  Service was good, they were helpful with picking out the entrees and we started with the caprese brochette combo salad and that was just phenomenal.  I love a good caprese to start, I ordered a combination plate of stuffed veal and gnocchi in a butter sauce.  Both were very rich and very good, veal was a little tough but very flavorful.  A few drinks and goofy pictures taken with the decor we got out of there for about $160 bucks but since I had the groupon it only cost me about $100 (I still tipped about $30).  I read a few reviews before ordering and couldn't help but notice the douche-bags that thought this place was overpriced.  Did you guys think you were going to Fazoli's?  WTF?  When your review is a few lines long only complaining about the price, you look more foolish than the restaurant.....just saying.

Really good experience here. To bad its so far away from my home and office. Anywho, had a business meeting at the Kierlands and took my sales director here for dinner and discussion afterward. As soon as you walk in your smell Italian. Reminded me of when I lived in New York. Took a seat and Chaz the waiter comes by and of course knows my employee. Good rapport is established and Chaz shows good product knowledge - he knows what he's doing and guides us through the menu. This seems to be a forgotten science these days with the "order taker" mentality of the turn and burn server of our microwave society. I digress.  We ordered the Calamari Infernalli which was sauteed in a spicy tomato sauce which was an awesome alternative to the usual bread coating. Just the right amount of spice kick - good stuff and recommended.   We both ordered Filetto Saltimbocca Del Porco as an entree. If I'm not mistaken Saltimbocca means melt in your mouth and that's exactly what it does. the pork loin is stuffed with cheese, sage and pancetta with a delicate sauce and was just awesome. Would coem back just for this again.   Great experience and nice job Chaz.

A taste of my grandmothers cooking. This restaurant holds a special place in my heart because it is the only authentic Italian place that cooks like my grandmother use to.  I use to come to this restaurant at least 1x week growing Up and hadn't been in 10 years. Food was better than I remember, staff was exceptional.

This place is what Italian food is all about.  Eat everything blindfolded because everything tastes like love and will take you to Italy on your first bite, guaranteed.  The staff and owner here are special.  They make you feel like you are coming over to Grandma's house for Sunday dinner, every time.  Come here and fall in love with the restaurant, please.  Enjoy the food and the best service in town!

All I can say is WOW. It's been a long time since I was as blown away by a meal the way I was last night at La Torretta. The dishes are simple, but phenomenal, the prices are reasonable and the service was great. We will definitely be back very soon to taste more of the menu.

I went here with my family before I met my wife and I remember enjoying the atmosphere, the service, and the food.   I called the day before to confirm our reservation for two.  Their dining room isn't huge, but every table is really comfortable.  I'm glad we were seated in a booth as this is always our preference in restaurants.  The table itself had padding on top with a white table cloth on top of that so when you rest your elbows on the table it's actually comfortable.  We just had regular waters and luckily they didn't taste like nasty Arizona tap water.  It tasted like filtered water to me which is a big plus because we have a reverse osmosis system in our house so we're very sensitive to tap water taste when eating out.  My wife ordered a Ravioli ai Funghi and I ordered Linguini with Pesto.  After placing our order, they brought us two freshly baked bread rolls with a super tasty olive oil based dipping sauce containing garlic, Italian spices (just a few fresh leaves, it looked like it could have been rosemary), tomatoes, and capers.  The olive oil wasn't a green color so I suspected it was an infused flavor like tomato basil.  We often get inspiration from restaurants with really good food so you can bet we're going to try to replicate this dipping oil in the future.  Shortly after we finished eating our free bread rolls, they brought our main courses out to us.  We were surprised our food came out so fast!  My Linguini with Pesto was really tasty (I didn't ask for anything extras like chicken or shrimp), but my wife's ravioli was out of this world.  Do you ever trade dishes with  your wife and wish you didn't have to give your plate back?  This was definitely one of those days!  The restaurant menu lists the ravioli as containing button mushrooms and shiitake mushrooms in a very light sage sauce with some vegetables.    We weren't sure about the sauce so we requested two additional side sauces: mushroom marsala and marinara.  I can safety say these two additional side sauces were not needed, but the mushroom marsala definitely complemented the flavor of this dish.  We did try it with the marinara as well, but it's too over powering for such a delicate ravioli and totally hides the mushroom flavor (this might be an option if you have a picky eater or kids, but why waste such food on them?!).  Let me tell you about the first bite into this ravioli.  If you love shiitake mushrooms like me (or mushroom in general) along with regular cheese ravioli, this will blow you away.  The explosion of flavors: shiitake, the button mushrooms, followed by the texture of the pasta holding it all together and cheese.  We went here for my wife's 30th birthday, but I'm already trying to make up an excuse for us to come back here so I can order this amazing dish and have it all to myself.  It's been a while since I had a "food high" when eating in a restaurant.  The first bite into this ravioli did it for me.  The ambiance of the restaurant was really romantic.  The lighting is dim and apparently we ordered at the right time as the restaurant started filling up shortly after we placed our main course order.  I thought the ceiling painted in a sky color was a nice touch (reminds me of The Venetian in Las Vegas) along with some stained glass window artwork near our table.  The music playing in the restaurant sounded like a dance club mix (played at a low volume).  This was fine with me since I'm a big fan of Tiesto and Oakenfold, but I also think that bossanova music would have been more suitable to the environment (think: Stan Getz & Joao Gilberto - Corcovado (Quiet Nights of Quiet Stars), Tom Jobin & Elis Regina - Aguas De Março, etc).  Our waiter Luiz was super friendly and very attentive to refilling our water and checking on the taste of our food.  My wife usually has to drink my water in most restaurants, but she was topped off enough times as her glass ran dry.  Our meal total was a very reasonable $53 including more than 20% tip which I added separately.  From entry to leaving, our total time in the restaurant was only 45 minutes.  Amazing.  We will be back!!!  P.S. As I hadn't been here in a few years, we were a little nervous about some of the negative reviews on Yelp and TripAdvisor.  While I could see this largely depending on the dish you order, I think this place is perfect for foodies like us who appreciate a home cooked Italian meal.  We're also curious about their squash ravioli, but I think we're both ordering the mushroom ravioli the next time we stop by.  Service was perfect, food was amazing, ambiance was great...what else do you need?  You can talk to each other without yelling unlike some popular restaurants in Kierland (which also have good food, but you can hardly hear each other).

Drove down from AJ for Dinner  Had eggplant and calamari pasta both excellent  Caesar Salad was one of the best I had  Service , owner and Staff very attentive and welcoming . The red sauce is off the Hook Delicious . Romantic atmosphere , incredible specials Huge Four Cheese stuffed Veal Chop , Veal Shank Osso  buco , Rack of Lamb just to name a few . The escargot appetizer was incredible !!!!!!

The food is ok, but nothing special.   The decor was really dated and cheesy.  But worst of all, the place was just rundown and dirty!  There was some sort of food dried and stuck on our booth.  The other booth was ripped and falling apart.  The carpet had a large rip going through most of the dining room.  Another reviewer characterized this place as being like a retirement home.  It definitely has that vibe.  We won't be going back.

Um, wow. Found this place on Groupon and decided to try it out. The food was amazing! Probably the best Italian food I have eaten since I left Italy in March. The food was piping hot and hard to resist as you wait for it to be cool enough to eat because you know it's delicious but you don't want to burn your tongue and miss out on how good it is. I called ahead to ask if they allowed dogs on the patio and they made sure to have a table set up with a table cloth, plates, and utensils before we arrived. The server was witty and just the right amount of a smart ass to be hilarious. The only negative thing I have to say is that they mentioned bread three times before it actually came and I was kinna hungry so I was looking forward to it each time it was mentioned. We did finally receive the bread on the third mention and it was also blissfully scrumptious.

We decided to spontaneously try this restaurant on a Thursday evening. Easy access and plenty of parking. Ambiance is old school Italian, frescoes on the walls, white table clothes and comfortable seating. Our waiter (who was excellent and attentive) informed us of specials and also that most pastas were made in house, veggies organic, chicken free range, fresh not frozen or farm raised fish. This wasn't noted in the menu or website but was certainly a nice surprise.   We started with Caesar salad which was very good, crisp lettuce, homemade croutons and high quality Parmesan cheese. Chicken Marsala was not on the menu but the chef had no problem making it. The dish came with veggies and our additional request of pasta. The other dish we ordered was eggplant Parmesan with penne. Both dishes were superb!    The Marsala had a good complement of mushrooms and the reduction was full flavored. The eggplant was perfectly cooked, generously covered with real mozzarella. Portions were more than ample and pricing very fair.   Dessert was cheesecake that tasted like it just came off the plane from New York, garnished with fresh berries and real whipped cream. This place is a great find. Mangia!  For the type of restaurant this is, it is deserving of a 5 star rating.

We decided to go here based on some reviews from friends.  The menu is 95% filled with items with veal or pork. So had less of a choice of dishes.  .  There raviolis are very small and they charge $3.00 for one.  They are just okay.  The sauce the ravioli come with is a little bit salty along with most of their pasta sauces a little too much salt for my liking.  The clam appetizer with the cucumbers and carrots were pretty good..  Everyone at the table enjoyed the olive oil and garlic mixture which came with the bread.  ... Just basic bread no real taste unless you use the garlic sauce which was yummy.  The breaded raviolis for app was just okay nothing was wow.  The Chilean Sea Bass $36.00 was a nice large piece cooked perfectly.  We expected great tasting food and were very disappointed until we got to dessert the Lemon gelato was the high light of the night.....But then we got home and we all were sick to our stomachs and spent most of the night in the bathroom...Not real sure what we ate but we got sick so not a good thing and the bill was kind of high for the amount of food we did not get....Since we do not eat veal or pork not lots of choices....The service was exceptional. but just stay away from the food which made us sick, thinking it was the sauce from the raviolis.  Might try for lunch, maybe they were having an off day or something.   We would return just for the lemon dessert

Hubs and I like to support family owned businesses. So, when we were craving Italian, we had to try this place out instead of the mega-restaurant maggianos across the street (nothing against maggianos).  Have to say this. CHAZ. Out server was unique and made the whole dining out experience a 5 star.  The food was probably more of a 3.5 or a 4. But Chaz made it top notch. He was engaging. Entertaining and made sure we felt at home.  He even made sure our leftovers got additional sauce and met our specs.   Will be back! Check in with Yelp for a discount.

I am originally from New Jersey and it has taken quite a bit of time for me to find a really outstanding Italian restaurant in the valley.  I have finally found it at La Torretta.  I came here with my family this weekend and I was very impressed with the intimacy of the space.  Our tables were already set for fine dining (which is a very classy touch), and the staff was so accommodating I actually wasn't completely sure who our main server was until the end as they were all so helpful and accommodating.  (extra points to them for working as a team!)  I started with the meatballs arribiatta which I was warned were on the spicy side.  I said that was alright and decided to be adventurous.  They were absolutely delicious with a lot of heat.  For my main course I got the filet mignon which was served with mushrooms and potatoes.  It was cooked perfectly and was the best filet I've had in years.  I can't wait for my next special occasion so I can try something else.  I kept eying the plates that went by and everything looked amazing.  Truly a great find.

I notice that some people give this establishment a low rating because of prices.  What they don't know, is that most Italian places (even high-end) have food that is cooked and ready before you even arrive, and even re-heated.  La Torretta is a special place that serves fresh food, and you get what you pay for here.  If you think it is "too pricey" for home-made Italian, then I'd suggest you never visit California, or cities like Chicago, NY etc. because La Torretta's prices are extremely reasonable in comparison.  And if you are wise enough to check Groupon.com, you'll find a generous deal of 50% off your bill.   The service for my wife and I was top-notch, and the atmosphere was fantastic.  We went when it was a bit slower, which is what I prefer for a romantic evening.  I've already purchased the Groupon deal for my brother-in-law, so I obviously have no problem recommending La Torretta to anyone.  A must try for any Italian lover!!

Yum, Yum, Yum!  Excellent authentic Italian food!  My hubby and I went out for a fantastic evening and decided to try this restaurant due to the reviews here and our restaurant.com gc!  Impressive!  The service was excellent and the food was to DIE FOR!  My husband had the chicken and sausage Cacciatore and he loved the freshness of the sauce...not overly processed but tasty.    I had the Four Cheese Chicken.  All I can say is:  arrive hungry!  The chicken itself would have been a little over the top but the combination of all the cheese and the amazing taste of the flavorful chicken just worked.  The mushroom demi-glaze was perfect with it.  Oh, and we had the fried Ravioli to start and it's much better than your run of the mill stuff others serve!  Again the Marinara makes it.  We paid about $60 including tip with our GC and we will return again and again and again!
Amazing pesto and all the food is made from scratch from the pasta to the vegetables. Excellent service.

Excellent food! Excellent service from Chas, he really took good care of us and we came in with five children and four adults so we were a handful!  They were accommodating doing half orders and the food was amazing. It felt like a small town home owned business. Careful when you're reading reviews from people because I noticed a lot of inaccurate comments about this place we've been there twice and actually really enjoy it. Make the decision for yourself. The food will speak for itself!

My husband and I came here for his birthday and had a great experience! The food was really good and we really enjoyed our waiter's sense of humor! I had the crab ravioli - it was to die for! My husband had the Veal Marsala and loved it as well! I would definitely recommend the Creme Brûlée for dessert - it was amazing! We would return!

Being from the East Coast, it is very difficult to find good authentic Italian food in Arizona. My family moved here in 2001 and have been to every restaurant you could imagine. Five years ago we had  the fortunate opportunity to have dinner at La Torretta Italian Restaurant and Steak House, which was highly recommended by a friend, and I have to say the food was excellent and the service was outstanding. Since then, we have had several birthday parties as well as Christmas office parties and often will go there for lunch. This restaurant is as good if not better than any Italian restaurant in New York or Jersey.

Absolutely delicious!  Homemade pasta that tastes as smooth as butter when it touches your tongue. Wine selection that makes your mouth water before you even take your first sip.  A definite try if you love genuine Italian cuisine and crave the magnificent taste of homemade pasta.

Old school Italian in all the best ways!  The bread and seasoned EVOO was amazing and an appetizer in itself.  I ordered the Eggplant Parm--not over breaded and fried yet tender and so flavorful!  As a vegetarian, this is my go to dinner and I have to say that it is the best I've had in the Valley!  Lastly, our waiter, Maria, talked us into the lemon sorbet for dessert.  It was a perfect ending to the night!    Also, the atmosphere was relaxed and the music was low enough that we could carry on a conversation without having to use our outside voices.  The wait staff is super professional and the owner cares about how you are enjoying your evening.  We will be back!

One of the best Italian restaurants where everything is homemade!! I thought that this place was absolutely delightful!!! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to have a delicious Italian meal!!! Our waiter was very nice and I really enjoyed the food. Check this place out if you're ever in North Scottsdale!

I had the bruschetta and caprese appetizer with the cannelloni fiorentino and gnocchi entre.   Great service. The manager/owner and different servers always made sure my drink was refilled. There was a large party dining in, but I was always cared for despite the crowd. I was placed in a booth near the window, perfect for me because I wanted a view of the mountains.   The appetizer was great. I'm not a fan of olives but the olives were cooked in some wine that made it edible. The salad was drenched in a delicious dressing. The bruschetta and mozzarella were okay.  I would try a salad over the bruschetta and caprese    The entre was huge. I don't have a big appetite in general but the dish I ordered looked like 2 pasta entre's. I would like for there to be more vegetables because the dish was very heavy.   I'd give the food 3 stars but the service 5 stars. I was comfortable dining there despite being a party of 1.

This is hands-down a 5-star establishment.  It is family owned and they take such good care of you.  Plus...the food is so incredibly delicious.  I travel everywhere and have been to more restaurants than I can count, but this is by far one of my top favorites!

Not sure what to expect based on earlier very mixed reviews, but WOW! Great service, amazing entrees. My husband was thrilled by his eggplant parmesan (his standard for Italian). I had escolar with a lemon caper sauce, lobster ravioli, steamed veggies, all done to perfection. Definitely will be back
Great food. great service. The owner obviously knows haw to please his patrons in every way.  Large portions of fabulous Italian classics. Go. You will be happy!

i ordered salmon with penne with vodka sauce,terrible,it was NOT SAlmon,it was a hard over done White fish,dried out,terrible. Our first and last time .The owner said it was salmon,but i eat salmon all the time,and it was Not,it was a white fish,terrible that he didnt care.He was rude.not what an owner should do.

Fantastic pasta, the bread so different and delicious! Love the oil with fresh sun dried tomatoes. My husband and I make it a point to come back here every time we are in the area. Owner Darius was a wonderful host. Did I mention martinis? They were made to perfection. See you next year!

Scratch this one off the list.  It was horrible.  We were enticed with a Travel Zoo coupon.  But it was not even worth 1/2 price.  It is a neighborhood Italian restaurant with no personality or charm.  Prices were definitely high for the ambiance and quality.  My fish was so "fishy" I couldn't eat it.  My wife had the eggplant and it was oily.   The bread was burned and dry.  Desserts at $9 was terrible.  They supposedly make their own Teramisu, so we tried it.  It was mostly fake whipped cream and the inside tasteless and soggy.  There are much better Italian restaurants in the area and more moderately priced.  The service was not up to par.  We got the wrong dish.  The waitress seemed like she really didn't care that we were there.  I doubt this place will make it much longer.  It was no more than a third full on a Saturday night.  Trust me on this and STAY AWAY.  It was one of the worst meals I've had in a long long time.  I'd rather go to a cafeteria.

WOW, I mean wow. This place has great customer service, excellent food and at a good price. Very romantic as well and somewhere I would recommend taking a date with your significant other or even for a first date with someone new.

4 stars only because the atmosphere isn't fantastic but the menu, service and food are all WONDERFUL! I have always wanted to try this place because it's literally right down the street from my house. Our server was an older gentleman who was very polite, very knowledgeable on the menu and personable! We got the meatballs to start and my ole faithful, chicken parm and both items were FANTASTIC! and very generous portions! I will definitely be back when I'm craving Italian! My mouth is watering as I type this!!!

I think this place could do well if they made some changes. First of all... the iced tea was not good. I think I recall a previous reviewer comparing the taste to Band-Aids. I've never tasted one, but the tea tasted as they smell... oddly plastic-y. My roommate ordered the chicken parm, and although he didn't say it was bad... he seemed remorseful from not ordering the Lobster Ravioli. In my opinion, it looked like it had way too much mozzerella, couldn't even see any breaded parts of the chicken. I ordered the cannelloni, a favorite of mine. I was dismayed when I saw it covered in meat sauce (which tasted canned). Now, in my many experiences in ordering this dish, it's always been paired with a cream sauce! The menu didn't specify. The good thing I suppose, was the gnocci served with it (which was good) had cream sauce and I would steal some of that and incorporate it into bites of my cannelloni. Creme brulee was not horrible, but the carmelized sugar could have been darker and more berries would've been nice for the price. So overall... it was ok, not great, but ok. The server was Chazz and was very personable and friendly.

I have eaten at La Torretta multiple times for dinner.  It is always fantastic!  No dish has ever disappointed and the wine is always perfect with the dish.  Immaculately clean and well kept, some may not like the decor as it is "old fashioned Italian."  When I walk in, I feel like I've walked into a decades-old, family-owned Italian restaurant that would be found in the burrows of New York.  I love that!!  If you love authentic Italian food, this decor is perfect!    For those of you who don't know, Sofia Loren's photos abound because the owner's Mom and Sophia were life-long friends.  For decades, whenever Sophia was in the area, she'd stop in to have dinner at La Torretta.  It does not get more authentic Italian than that!  If Chaz happens to be serving you, ask him to sing you a song.  You'll be blown away!
Best Italian ever. Always amazing service. Gluten free options. I always order the smoked Chicken over pasta with a white sauce and creme brûlée. It's amazing!

Let's begin with the atmosphere and Decour, this is a non-pretentious place and is focused on  customer first, good service, quality food, and reasonable prices. The evening started with an order of calamari and a wonderful Chianti to kick things off. The The second course comprised of wonderful cheese ravioli talked with small Walmart chips you gave it a wonderful woodsy flavor.  The only decision left is to do dessert would you have a rack of lamb call it a night! Only kidding, how about a crème brûlée for dessert.   If you're looking for a restaurant that serves  quality food with great flavors and old fashion gravy(that sauce for you Southerners) then this is the place for you.

First time there and was very satisfied. Was not that hungry but was in the mood for Italian. The service was excellent and later found out that the other waiter was the owner. Very nice and personable. We can tell a good Italian restaurant by the Sauce and the Calamari. I give them both 5 out of 5. The Caesar salad was different but delicious and the hot bread was served with a delicious oil. We decided to split a 4 cheese chicken dish. The waiter was nice enough to split this and add a little spaghetti. Truthfully, after the large Calamari, Caesar salad and bread we had to still take home half the dinner.
Fabulous service and authentic Italian cuisine!  Try the sautéed calamari and cannoli for dessert.  Everything on the menu is amazing- I'll be back!
This is a great family owned restaurant. great wine selection particularly the new Pinot from jwrigley vineyards. You will not be disappointed.
We were greeted upon entry by two very nice people.  The food was the best and deliciously prepared.  The attention was spectacular.  Our waiter was superb.

I came to La Torrenta with a friend using a Groupon.  We each were able to choose an entree and get a bottle of wine.  We got the crab and lobster ravioli.  The crab ravioli was good, but the lobster ravioli my friend got was even better.  It is the best tasting crab ravioli I ever had.  The only thing that takes this from a 5 star experience is the service was a little slow.  Our waiter didn't write down our order, and we asked about our side salads.  He said its being made, and he came back with it in couple minutes.  It seemed like our waiter was a little bit forgetful.  Nevertheless, he was a good server that entertained us with his sarcasm.

Best family owned italian place in scottsdale. Crab rav. Is amazing o so. Buco.having to use abbreviations sorry but amazing . Worth the trip tucked in a lil corner near promenade shopping center on other side. They use to have an amazing lobster rav. Not shure what happened hope that pops back on menu. Def worth a visit.
